::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# manually make the dataframe
pizza <- tribble(
    ~name, ~kind, ~cost,
    "The Degenerate", "sm", 20,
    "The Degenerate", "lg", 30,
    "The Degenerate", "gf", 26,
    "Waldorf", "sm", 20,
    "Waldorf", "lg", 26,
    "Waldorf", "gf", 30,
    "Cheese", "sm", 15,
    "Cheese", "lg", 25,
    
    
)

pizza <- tribble(
    ~raw,
    'The Degenerate 20/30/26',
    'Waldorf 20/26/30',
    'Cheese 15/25/19',
    'Brooklyn 20/30/26',
    'Pepperoni 18/28/22',
    'Margherita 18/28/22',
    "Mama Lil's Marinara 14/23/18",
    'Hot Coppa 20/30/26',
    'Roasted Vegetable 20/30/26',
    'Santorini 20/30/26',
    'Hot Italian Sausage 20/30/26',
    'Prosciutto di Parma 20/30/26',
    'Truffle 20/30/26',
    'Potato-Ricotta 20/30/26'
) %>% 
    extract(raw, 
            into = c("name", "size"),
            regex = "([A-Za-z ']+) ([0-9/]+)") %>% 
    separate(size, 
             sep = "/", 
             into = c("sm", "lg", "gf"),
             convert = T) %>% 
    pivot_longer(cols = -name, names_to = "kind", values_to = "cost")

pizza
```

::: {.cell-output-stdout}

```
   name           kind   cost
   <chr>          <chr> <int>
 1 The Degenerate sm       20
 2 The Degenerate lg       30
 3 The Degenerate gf       26

 5 Waldorf        lg       26
 6 Waldorf        gf       30
 7 Cheese         sm       15
 8 Cheese         lg       25
 9 Cheese         gf       19
10 Brooklyn       sm       20
# … with 32 more rows
```
